author: {'steamid': '76561198001779896', 'num_games_owned': 1487, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1596500464}
review:
Have fun playing as a sentient garbage truck in a kid-friendly sci-fi story with an opinion on climate change! Based on the Disney-Pixar film, [i]WALL•E[/i] the game lets you become the last remaining Waste Allocation Load Lifter Earth-Class robot on the planet. Like the movie, WALL•E navigates through a deserted, trash-filled world crushing garbage into small cubes, all the while developing child-like traits beyond its programming, such as curiosity and joy.

The game incorporates WALL•E's cubes—as well as his built-in laser beam, music player and solar panel—as puzzle game mechanics to traverse the harsh environment. The good folks at Buy N Large (the mega-retailer safeguarding humanity until life can thrive again) have left other cubes lying around the wasteland, the contents of which help WALL•E open doors, recharge his batteries, and replenish his laser. The plot thickens with the arrival of EVE, a sleek, curvy floating droid that lands on WALL•E's doorstep via space rocket.

The developers of [i]WALL•E[/i] did a great job sticking to the movie's visual style, as well as the broad strokes of its plot, while forging their own parallel storyline. Part of game's charm is the light touches of humor scattered throughout. Remember that montage in the movie where WALL•E collects human junk found in the trash and misinterprets its original use? The game turns that into a treasure hunt within each level. Collect all the hidden artifacts and you win points tradeable for cheat codes and bonus materials, but also you get rewarded with cutesy skits of WALL•E playing with the objects.

The game's elements are neither original nor very challenging, but together they make an engaging experience. Roguelike fans should steer away from this casual and very forgiving third-person 3D action game for kids. Low difficulty aside, I got a kick out of how the game pays homage to different games and genres. Racers, skateboard sims, stealth games, rail shooters, color pattern memory games, flight sims, even [i]Frogger[/i] of all things. My biggest surprise playing [i]WALL•E[/i], 10 years after purchasing it for my kid, is how good the in-game graphics look in modern resolutions like 1080p and 4K.

Which brings me to the most notable flaw in [i]WALL•E[/i] the video game, which are the cutscenes. While the in-game ones look fantastic, the ones between levels are video files in NTSC format, an image resolution lower than that of DVD movies. Guess how crappy those scenes look blown up to 1080p. In addition, you cannot skip them unless you finish and replay a level, which annoys me to no end. Also, while the game uses clips and sound design from the movie to  to great effect, they actually got the great Jeff Garlin to reprise his role as the Captain of the Axiom ... and made him phone in his performance! What gives?

Still, I enjoyed playing [i]WALL•E[/i] very much, in case this wasn't abundantly clear. Movie tie-in games usually get a bad rap for falling somewhere between a well-intentioned mess an a senseless cash grab. Every assumes games based on a licensed intellectual property only cater to fans of said IP. (Statistically, most of them do suck!) Fortunately, [i]WALL•E[/i] counts as a pleasant exception worthy of the 6-8 hours you'll breeze through to complete it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335171788', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1701501992}
review:
First of all, I played this game as a kid on Play Station 2.
This was one of my childhood games after I finally got a PS2 one Christmas.
Wall-E came bundled with the console and I absolutely loved the game!

Now, this games controls are absolutely shocking, but like it was the same on PS2, nothing will change. 
Graphics are kinda dated too but if you want a solid Disney experience and in my opinion the best game from a Disney movie then this is it.

I got 5 hours of gameplay for the whole playthrough and enjoyed every minute. Time may vary cause the game does have bad controls and I found myself wanting to find glitches and cool spots through the maps. There is also lot's of replayability due to the little cheats menu and extra's menu and there is also multiplayer although I don't know how good that would be cause I haven't played it.

It is a little dare, but I reckon I enjoyed it for the price and will be back for nostalgic reasons. Have some childhood fun and just play it! Would totally recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198178480001', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1671771088}
review:
Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game is an experience, and a joyful one at that. I bought Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game because I had it on the Nintendo Wii in 2008. After recently selling my Nintendo Wii, along with my games for it, I realized I never completed Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game, yet had made a promise to myself that I would complete Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game in the future. And the future is now. After buying Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game on Steam for approximately twenty United States dollars, I loaded up the game, only to be filled with a sense of pure nostalgia. The flashy musical intro, with the song "Put on Your Sunday Clothes" from "Hello Dolly", the song that repeats throughout the film, alongside the visuals of the blueprints for the various machinery in the WALL-E universe, was a joy to see once more. After playing though the tutorial of the game once more, I came under the realization that Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game's mechanics are like no other I have ever come across. Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game uses gameplay ideas and mechanics that no other games have dared to attempt the way they have. In order to make certain jumps throughout the game, you must gain momentum, in order to reach said heights. However, gaining momentum in order to make jumps and flips on half-pipes, it does not feel like a Sonic the Hedgehog game, because unlike a Sonic the Hedgehog game, Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game works outstandingly well in 3D. Jumping aside, the variety of different gameplay in Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game is outstanding. There are some parts of Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game where you seek out required materials, some where you get to fly as the drone "EVE" and blast objects in the way with her cannon arm, and there are even sections where you can see through WALL-E's perspective with a laser of his own, making this game a first person shooter. WALL-E himself has a variety of abilities, such as picking up blocks of dirt, being a clever reference to Disney•Pixar WALL-E (The Movie). I do not wish to spoil much of Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game, because I urge you to go out and play this game, and realize for yourself the vast gameplay you can find in Disney•Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game.

also wall-e has a gun and that is really cool lmao

author: {'steamid': '76561198285228319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1654733593}
review:
Помните те времена,когда приходя домой вы  запускали игру Walle?Если нет то видать вы не застали то время) Эта игра про робота,который очищает планету от мусора.Люди давно покинули землю из за мусора.В один было точно также.Перерабатывал мусор как вдруг с неба появляется космо-корабль и высаживает на землю нового робота,чтобы проверить изменилось что либо на земли спустя большого кол-во времени.
После знакомства Walle с этим роботом, он все таки находит то, зачем и высадили его сюда.Это было РАСТЕНИЕ, а что случилось дальше вы это уже узнаете сами =)
Я приобрел эту игру только из за ностальгии.Помню времена,когда мы с моим другом сидели и играли ее на моем компе.Гоняли на гонках и даже нам удавалось найти БАГИ в этой игре, хотя я тогда был маленьким и не понял,что это.Было смешно когда я проваливался сквозь текстуры и думал,что проиграл. 
Короче говоря рекомендую в том случае,если вы ностальгируете или же любите коллекционировать игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194911018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1706750401}
review: I would recommend this game in a heartbeat. I was obsessed with the movie as a kid and loved the game when the movie was out. It played a special role in my childhood just like Spyro did. I love platformers in gaming and this one made for a great platformer. Although it's not my favorite video game ever made, it is most definitely my favorite movie video game tie in. I prefer the PS2/PSP/PC versions of this game over the PS3/360/Wii and DS versions of this game. Are you a Pixar fan? Do you love this movie? Do you love movie video game tie ins? If the answer to any of these questions is a yes, then definitely play this game. It's actually a lot of fun. And the graphics are surprisingly good for a ps2 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060434019', 'num_games_owned': 2386, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1598452430}
review:
7/10


Graphics
☐ Beautiful
☐ Average
☑ Outdated (Very muddy textures in some places)
 
Gameplay
☑ Fun
☐ Average
☐ Repetitive   

Audio
☐ High quality
☐ Average 
☑ Low 

Difficulty
☐ Hard
☐ Average
☑ Easy

Story
☑ Great (Fits together better than the movie in my opinion)
☐Average
☐ Low quality

Bugs
☐ None that i came across
☑ A couple (namely vaulting sometimes bugs out)
☐ Gamebreaking Bugs

Summery
Quite a charming game, i played this first on the psp back in the late 2000's, It's actually not that much different than the pc version, minus a couple of levels. 
The Games' Story seemed to fit better as a narrative than the actual movie itself which is interesting, not many games that are licensed by movies seem to end up like this, so nice to see.
in terms of graphics, dont expect anything better than ps2 era, its VERY low quality in pretty much every asset apart from eva, wall-e and a few other items, in terms of texture maps, they look like bald textures in some places, lacking any sort of 'texture' ironically.
Gameplay is really what i came for, which i enjoyed, works much better with the mouse input, though it's designed for console, so makes some sections ludicrously easy, 
(though i guess it is aimed at younger children).
i would say worth a playthrough, i liked some of the licensed games from this era, 2007-2012 they had a certain charm not found in modern games, that clinically arcade feel which has been lost to realism.

Sometimes its fun to sit back and play a game that doesn't try to hard to take itself seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170435999', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1657812115}
review:
I decided to pay the full 20$ for this game, for the nostalgia and everything, and at first I was disappointed. This game is NOT meant for PC, I repeat NOT. It may have the controls and optimization for pc but it was not built to work with pc controls.
That being said if you do not own a controller that you can hook with steam and play games like this with, do not get it.
The game has aged pretty well, some areas have a design and soundtrack that make it almost timeless, others do not and sometimes bug out. Like on the Axiom, there were times where the gravity cubes would bug out and clip through the wall, this means I was not able to complete the puzzle and would have to restart. 
Another time I'd notice that you could see through certain parts of the maps or notice missing textures in cutscenes behind things that normally outside of the cutscene you would not be able to see.
Otherwise, for what this game was back when ps2/xbox 360 were the big things, this game was absolutely one of the best titles you could get for a kid, and I'd still recommend it for a gift to a younger kid who would appreciate the love and care that was put into this game.
9/10 would play for 100 more hours lol

review: This game is a very fun version of WALL-E the movie. It lets you play through your favorite scenes as WALL-E and EVE. My grandson bought me this game because WALL-E is my favorite movie. I got a Steam account just for this (please ignore my 400 other games, those are my grandson's). I really loved the part where WALL-E becomes Frogger. It was really fun but I wish it lasted longer. The multiplayer is also amazing. I played it with my grandson yesterday and he said it was "space aids." I'm not sure what that means but I think it's slang for something really cool and fun. Please let me know in the comments if you know what it means. I love WALL-E and Pixar and John Lasseter!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014018551', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1661744404}
review: I had this game as a kid on the Playstation 2, I was feeling nostalgic and decided to pick up the PC version on Steam.  Was not disappointed.  Great controls that really fit how Wall-E's designed as a robot.  There were many good puzzles, nothing too complicated.  Plenty of secrets.  Some jumps were a bit unforgiving, but that's fine, as it was only a small few of them, the rest were great.  The story was pretty faithful to the movie, aside from one instance of a deleted scene being used instead of the actual one seen in the movie.  Overall, great game.  Definitely a must have purchase for fans of both puzzle-platformers and the Wall-E movie.

review: A pure nostalgia ride. Played the game religiously as a little kid and it is just like I remember. Beyond even the nostalgia the game is fun with good gameplay and enjoyable level design. Short and sweet with me taking 1.7 hours to get halfway through. However, hard to recommend at $20 if you did not play it as a child and won't experience the nostalgia. Overall, the perfect game.

review: Hands down one of the best video games ever made. The sheer quality of the missions alone should show you how much thought and love has been put into constructing this digital world. Each location has a distinct feeling and style, which provides to the overall experience. With a superb cast of characters and a oscar-worthy soundtrack, this is an instant buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055641699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1691975446}
review:
This game is my childhood, I love it.

This is a very good game and the best of the 4 WALL-E video games. It's a pretty good platformer that follows the events of the movie with minor changes here and there. There are a decent amount of simple puzzles in the game in the form of door panels, nothing too hard just simple minigames. The game also has pretty good music. Overall it's a fun game that I played a lot as kid.

review:
I have no previous nostalgia for this game and still found it to be enjoyable. I finished it in around 4 hours and during that time I experienced a good variety of game play, with many optional secrets to find if I wanted.
The rest of my recorded steam time is from when I handed the game to my 4 year old...this is easily his favourite game. Would highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198871789260', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1589823605}
review:
Que decir de este juego..
Si bien es bastante corto (4 horas aprox.) te lleva a recordar una parte de tu infancia. Al menos en mi caso Wall-E es sin duda mi película favorita de la infancia y por ende le tengo mucho aprecio a este juego. Incluso jugarlo hoy en día me lleva unos años atras cuando lo jugaba por primera vez en la PS2, que tiempos lpm. Bueno, eso. Me encantaría que durase algunas horas mas pero me da igual, lo puedo re-jugar cuantas veces quiera y no me voy a cansar nunca.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165991280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1529703328}
review:
Şimdi direk markadan girelim. Wall-E gerçekten harika bir marka ve filmi de gerçekten bir şaheser. Bunu deme amacım bu oyunla birlikte buradan bir çıkarım yapacağim. Konuya dönersek bu Wall-E markasının sahibi Disney ve bu adamlar acayip zengin adamlar. Gelmiş geçmiş en çok kazandıran iki film olan Avatar ve Avengers: Endgame bu şirketin filmleri. Sorum şu. Bu kadar kazanmalarına neden oyunlara gerekli ilgiyi göstermiyorlar? Zamanında Avatarın oyununu oynarken de aynı şeyleri hissetmiştim. Neyse, ne demek istediğimi anlamışsınızdır. Wall-E de maalesef Avatar oyunu ile aynı kaderi paylaşmakta. Oyunun çıkış amacı filmin rüzgarıyla iyi para kazanmak. Bakalım nasıl bir oyunmuş

SENARYO

Oyunun senaryosu filmle paralel gidiyor. Oyun bölümlere ayrılmış. Her bölümde bir objektifi tamamlayıp diğerine geçmeye çalışıyoruz. Arada ufak tefek çocukça seviyede bulmacalar var. Genel olarak oyun bu. Hikaye ile ilgili spoiler vermek istemiyorum çünkü filmi izleyip oynamak size maksimum zevki verebilir. Eğer her şeyi söylersem oyunu oynamanız için bir sebep kalmaz.

OYNANIŞ

Oynanış mekanikleri açıkçası zamanına göre gayet rahat. Karakteri kullandığınızı gerçekten hissediyorsunuz. Tek sorun kamera açısında. Kamerayı istediğimiz gibi yönlendiremiyoruz buda oyunda kontrölcüyü gerekli kılıyor.

Genel hatlarıyla oyun bu. Filme çok saygı duyduğum için oynadım ve yer yer eğlendim ama kessinlikle yeterli içeriğe sahip değil oyun. Mallesef diğer disney oyunlarının gölgesinde kalmış.

"+"ları:
Oyun Wall-E filminden esinleniyor ve filmin dünyası iyi aktarılmış.
Oyunun mekanikleri zamanına göre gayet iyi.
Hikaye filmin hikayesi o yüzden direk artı puan.

"-"leri:
Bölüm dizaynı kötü.
Bulmacalar gereksiz kolay.
Yeterli içerik yok.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198126907300', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1590350217}
review: Wall-e is not any kind of game, it's a game that truly makes you question how you didn't find this game sooner, it gives a completely new meaning to video games, with the amazing graphics, amazing story and amazing smooth gameplay. There really isn't a better game than Wall-e. Wall-e answers the questions like: What is the meaning of life?, What happens after death?, Is life real?, Why does dad hit me? Etc. It really is something special... You really wouldn't think that it's that much of a special game at first glance but when you play it you realize more and more how fantastic the game actually is... The only con is that people might make fun of you because it's a "kids game", but they aren't real friends anyways, right? So I would 100% recommend this game to anyone who seeks for the most amazing and fascinating game on this platform. It truly is something special and I think that everyone should experience this amazing experience that Wall-e will give you.

review:
Większej nostalgii dawno nie czułem, z życia wzięte - grałem w to na PS2, tylko problem był taki że pograłem do momentu [spoiler]gdy poznawaliśmy EVE i musieliśmy się z nią ścigać[/spoiler] bo dalej nie chciało mi wczytywać :( i nigdy za dzieciaka nie skończyłem tej cudownej gierki, dopiero 3-4 lata temu (aktualizuje recenzje 13.03.2022r.) wpadłem na pomysł żeby zobaczyć czy nie ma aby Wall-ego na steamie... i to piękne uczucie dziecięcej radości dorosłego człowieka jest niesamowite, od razu ograłem i dokończyłem coś czego nie mogłem dokonać "za dzieciaka" mega doświadczenie

Wiem nikt nie pytał ale taka o historia na faktach z życia

author: {'steamid': '76561198056812873', 'num_games_owned': 1135, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1691903749}
review:
[h1]# Игра детства [/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1639697512
Эх, ностальгия... Я помню, когда мы с другом играли в WALL-E на PSP. Это было незабываемое чувство! Мы, два дошкольника, пытались дотумкать, как проходить следующий уровень, и как же блаженно было, когда мы его проходили, и вылезала жёлтая табличка о нашей результативности. Огромное спасибо Steam, что они дали мне окунуться в ностальгию. Пусть немного криво, но дали.

[h1] Техническая составляющая [/h1]
Но у порта на компьютер есть большие проблемы, омрачающие игровой процесс. Управление изначально стоит неудобно, и его можно поменять только один раз. Чтобы это сделать позже, нужно покопаться в папке. Но вот иннервированную камеру исправить мне не удалось. В этом то и проблема, что на PSP и PS2 управление поудобнее, а вот для ПК разработчики не сделали всё как следует, а именно. Идеальным вариантом было бы то, если бы управление можно было менять в самой папке с игрой, а не в сторонних файлах.

[h1] Сюжет [/h1]
Это всё не отменяет того, что ВАЛЛ-И - отличная детская игра, в которой присутствуют интересные логические задания. Сюжет же происходит до/после и параллельно мультфильму, отлично дополняя его. Есть и отличия, но все они сделаны в угоду интереса к игре и удобства игрового процесса.

[h1] Музыкальное сопровождение [/h1]
Музыка здесь такая же ламповая как и в мультфильме, ибо часть, собственно, и взята из фильма. Но те мелодии, что написаны специально для игры не дают упасть игре в грязь и в целом смотрятся ориганично.

[h1] Графика [/h1]
Несмотря на распирающее чувство ностальгии при ознакомлении с портом, скажу, что графика в этой игре неумолимо устарела. Если на PSP с маленьким экраном она и смотрелась адекватно, то на ПК текстурки выглядят замыленно, а анимации криво.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1639697551
[h1]Но всё вышеперечисленное не умаляет заслуг игры. На мой субъективный взгляд - это одна из лучших игр по фильмам или мультикам. Она не выжимает все соки из покупателя, дарит приятный игровой процесс и лучше знакомит нас с персонажами мультфильма "ВАЛЛ-И"[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198050644859', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1532959240}
review: This... game... is... AMAZING. Like think about it? You play it and there is more to Wall-E then meets the eye. There is literally almost every kind of genre. The tags are just the start of it. There is FPS and TPS. Not only that but it's a free roam, slightly open world and even a PLATFORMER. LIKE THIS MAN HAS MARIO BEAT TO SHIT. THERE IS NOTHING LEFT OF THAT MAN. NEXT FPS OF THE CENTURY IS THIS GAME. DOWN WITH COD THIS IS BALLIN'. THIS IS ADVENTURE. THIS IS A LOVE STORY. THIS IS EVERYTHING. THE DIAMOND IN THE RUFF PERFECT GAME. PLAYED IT IN TWO SITTINGS. ALSO THERE IS MULTIPLAYER! WHAT MORE DO YOU WANT?

author: {'steamid': '76561198330118706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1543478220}
review:
I don't want to fault this game - it's a charming game based on an equally memorable movie and character, and that alone is rare, BUT, for anyone who was wondering, this is the PS2/Wii port of the game, NOT the higher-def X360/PS3 version that was released soon after.

It's still a very playable, easy trip down memory lane, and impressive to see the quality isn't too diluted when bumped up from 800 x 600 to modern widescreen.

review:
[h1]ЕЕЕЕЕЕВВВВВААААААА![/h1]
[h1]МОЯ НОМИНАЦИЯ[/h1]
 ПРИКОЛЬНАЯ ИГРА ПО МУЛЬТИКУ 2008 ГОДА
[h1]ПЛЮСЫ[/h1]
+ Хорошая графика игры для рекламы мультфильма
+ Прикольный и ламповый саундтрек
+ Интересно играть
[h1]МИНУСЫ[/h1]
- Высокая цена 
- Ближе к концу игры надоедает играть
- Неудобная камера
[h1]КОНЕЧНЫЕ ВОСПАМИНАНИЯ И ВВЫВОД[/h1]
Помню как я играл её на psp. Эххх были, времена! Сама игра добротная и интересная, но ее будет интереснее играть детям, чем взрослым.
[h1]ОЦЕНКА[/h1]
6 из 10 Валли про-скейтеров гоняющие по космосу за белым ведром

author: {'steamid': '76561198282493429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1646522730}
review:
Stara, ale nie wygląda jakoś szczególnie źle... Znaczy, ziemia jako taka porzucona i zanieczyszczona pasuje jak najbardziej, ale Aksjomat (czy jak mu tam) wygląda co najmniej dość... Specyficznie. Ale ja się bawiłem dobrze. Oprawa audio w porządku.

Wiele rzeczy mogłoby być zrobionych lepiej, ale jak na tamte czasy to nie ma co narzekać.

Przedstawia to historię inną niż poznaną w filmie, ciekawostka - widzimy bardziej "pierwotną" wersję fabuły (pomijając skakanie po różnych przeszkodach, nad przepaściami etc. oraz "misje dodatkowe")

Proszę mieć na uwadze, że gra jest stara. Nawet bardzo stara. Nie ma aktualizacji, dalszego rozwoju i innych "standardowych" rzeczy.

Still better love story than Twilight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005057754', 'num_games_owned': 1275, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1523034011}
review:
I must be officially old, because I'm waxing nostalgic over a game based off a movie that I loved when I was 18.  Ah, well.

WALL-E had a lot of official games when it came out.  This one is the PC version, which is apparently the same as the PS2 version and maybe the PSP version (if the rumors I heard were correct).   It follows the movie for the most part, although it has two major differences: [spoiler]a sequence at the beginning where WALL-E thinks he's found another functioning WALL-E robot[/spoiler] and [spoiler]AUTO electrocuting EVE instead of WALL-E, which fun fact was originally going to be how the movie went but they changed it at the last minute[/spoiler].  Yes, I spoilered it.  Screw you.  But anyway, yeah, if you've seen WALL-E, you know what to expect storywise pretty much.

The gameplay itself is...not the worst I've ever seen in a licensed game.  In fact, I'd say it's pretty good even, once you get the keys bound right or use a controller.  Mouselook is impossible here, don't even try.  Seriously.  Anyway, it's a 3D platformer/puzzle game, with some shooting minigames and Frogger clones for good measure.  Combat is laughably easy, provided you just box form everything to death.  The puzzles are fun, and vaguely remind me of Portal at times (it's because of all the robots and cubes).  Graphics are pretty good, and the robot models all look good (the humans are another story).  Soundtrack is nowhere near as beatiful as the movie's, but it has some great tunes (the one that plays during speedway sections comes to mind).  The little animations that play whenever WALL-E finds an artifact are the cutest thing ever.

All in all, I might be blinded by nostalgia here, but this is one of the better licensed games I've played.  I'd even say that it stands pretty well on its own.   10/10, would watch two robots fling a ski mask at each other again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212062988', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1668940151}

Если бы не один минус: в стимовской версии отсутствует русский язык, когда я запустил игру, я был в шоке, но всегда можно решить эту проблему русификатором и минус, как бактерия, уничтожена!

-
10/10.

review:
I got this game on sale for like 5 bucks, and it's AWESOME. I had the console version of this, as well as the PC demo when I was younger, so I decided, "why not"? I was not disappointed. The controls were kind of weird to get used to at first, but I got the hang of it. It's charming and cute, but action-packed at the same time. I definitely recommend picking this one up if it's on sale, or even if it's not. If you're a completionist and would want to beat this 100%, I genuinely wish you the best of luck. Seriously.

TL;DR, Got it on sale for 5 dabloons, loved it to death, controls were slightly weird, 100 percenting is stupidly hard, stop reading this and buy the freaking game already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093268594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1519700300}
review:
Put on your Sunday clothes, for its a nostalgic review.

Wall-E is and will always be my favourite Disney movie. When I was a kid back in 2008. I remember seeing the movie on my birthday and I remember becoming obsessed over it, so it was only natural that the game would fall into my hands. I got a Wall-E action figure, which still one of my prized possessions today, and I am writing this review with it by my side. I remember at the time I used to hum and sing the Hello, Dolly songs from the movie all of the time. Even though I only knew the segments that were in the movie/game. But as time went on and my young mind moved onto other things, the my disk copies of the movie and this game fell into oblivion. I only just remembered within the last two months that this game existed. I remembered the great and frustrating times I've had with this game on my old Windows XP. And now in December of 2017, as an young adult, I finally returned to this game to write my nostalgic review.

Wall-E the video game is predominately a puzzle solving platformer style game, with some racing style stages and rail shooter mixed in. The game has a similar storyline to that of the movie, but with some divergences. Between each chapter there is a cut scene, which is basically a shortened/simplified version of what happened in the movie. Of course, in these types of games you do inevitably get the, ‘what the hell do i do’ kind of moments. I remember as a kid spending what seem to be constant hours of prostration wondering what I should do, or trying to do that one jump, but in my new play through I didn't have nearly as much problems. But as a kid I never read the instructions, so that explains a lot. 

It was and still is always a joy to hear the Hello, Dolly music every time I boot up the game, complete a chapter, and watch the credits, along with the games original soundtrack, which is unique to the game, but the soundtrack is not quite as impressive as I remember it to be. Also I found a quite surprisingly that in the credits of the game, every single musician involved in the making of the original soundtrack is credited in the credits under the instrument that they played. Though in the movie they used the version from the original 1969 Hello, Dolly movie, but in the game they use a reproduction version. A minor issue that I disapprove of. 

Surprisingly to my adult self, the game isn't a complete and utter cash grab as I thought it was. A lot of time, effort, and content, has actually been put into the game. The main storyline took me roughly 6 hours to complete with some quite well designed and diverse stages. Heck, Wall-E the video game from 2008 has more content then the latest 2017 EA games.

I also like how the game has some after the credits stages, with Earth being colonised. The stages you saw at the start of the game are now green and lush, but crawling with enemies. There is also such a stage that takes place inside the Axiom as well. All something which I thought was a really nice feature, considering that we only have the ending credits of the movie to guess what happened. But is the video game ending technically cannon?

The game is not incredibly difficult to complete. But it's a kids game, what do you expect? 

Unlike other older games on Windows 10 like Rome Total War and Fallout III, Wall-E starts up and runs perfectly well on Windows 10. No fiddling around with game files required. And the game at self is bug free. Only once I had to restart a chapter because of an one off issue with the level design.

Just like in the movie, Wall-E has a cassette player that plays Put on your Sunday Clothes. The cassette player is used to call/attract Reject robots to follow and to complete tasks, which is necessary to complete some chapters. This is definitely a really nice feature, but it would be great if you didn't have to hold Y all the time to play the cassette player

Now on to the negatives. 

Wall-E normally costs twenty NZD, which for such an old game is very much overpriced. I got my steam copy for six NZD during the winter sale, which is far more reasonable. So only buy this game when it is on sale.

When you boot up the game for the very first time, a menu will pop up; a menu which is similar to the ones you see when you start up some unity games. At the time I wasn't aware of this, but it was a sort of an installation menu. This is the only menu in the game where you can adjust the resolution of the game. Because this game is made in the pre-wide screen days, unless you adjust the resolution, the game will look kind of stretched on modern screens, but the game was never meant to be graphically stunning anyway. So I think it is a necessary step when playing older games like Wall-E, to adjust the resolution accordingly. But once you press play on that menu you cannot open it up again, and no, you cannot adjust the resolution in the games options. You can only adjust sound and sensitivity in the options menu. 

There is only four chapters in the main storyline where you get to play as Eve and all of those chapters are flying/timed races style stages. On none of the regular chapters can you play as Eve. I didn't think this was a problem when I was a kid, but looking back on it as an young adult it kind of is. She as an laser gun in her arm for crying out loud. In the cutscenes she can one shot the police robots. While I'm sitting there trying to deal with all the police robots. Just metres away, Eve is just standing there waiting for me to complete the puzzle and open the door. There is only one stage near the end of the game that is not in a cutscene, where you can see her actively flying around and gunning down enemies. Just something I thought while playing the game.

The Games camera, which is controlled via the mouse, can be really annoying inside tight spaces, especially when enemies at nearby. So the camera can be super annoying sometimes. 

But overall, apart from some other minor issues. Wall-E the video game is actually quite a good and enjoyable game, especially if your playing for nostalgia sake. Again, only buy when on sale. I would give Wall-E a seven out of ten and a nostalgic seal of approval.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373847005', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1574222575}
review:
Wall-E 
One of my favourite games i had when i was younger
its still as fun as i remember, i still get that nostalgic feeling 
10/10
now for a in-depth review

PRO's
-Sound Effects and Music are Spot on
-Collectibles and Rewards are really cool (buying concept art for destroying crates and finding a rubber ducky)
-Levels (these were a bit challenging as a kid but not anymore, but they were fun, the only level i hated was flying with eve on earth[without a controller] )
-Comedy is perfect for a children’s game (which it is)
-Npc's look the best look fucking hilarious [http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1211881772](im one of those who dont care about how it looks just how fun it is)
-Mechanics are Useful and creative (like robots, putting your music on will interact with them, hey it is good music)
-Story (isn’t the same which makes it a bit better, had to shake it up a bit, and it wouldn’t make sense)
-its just really fun

CON'S
-wish it had all ports available, i never had it on DS and apparently, there was more places to explore as in open world.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198133532547', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1641235183}
review:
WALL-E - THE GAME THAT TIME FORGOT.
I got this game about 9 years ago when it first came out, and i was a young boy at that time. I Absolutely loved it. I played for hours on end and i loved the music, locations and the unique puzzles it had. Its such a shame barely anyone remembers this game. The nostalgia just makes me cry. I love this game so much, and i will remember it as the game of my childhood. Ahh... This game brings me back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061408291', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1706920451}
review:
Throughout my life, and perhaps many other lives that people have had, there's always this one phase related to a movie, TV show, or video game [spoiler][strike]but perhaps that's just me[/strike][/spoiler] and you just can't shake it off your mind. WALL-E is the biggest example of a game AND movie like that. And to be completely fair, this game ISN'T shovelware, unlike most IPs based on movies and shows!

[h1][b][u]Introduction and TL;DR[/u][/b][/h1]

WALL-E is a game published by THQ and Developed by  Asobo Studio, and man does it impress me. Whilst the story is a bit rushed in the cutscenes in game and it doesn't exactly match the movie it's based off of, this game is amazing not only for the fact that it's not shovelware, and that it plays extremely well. The real "Flaws" I call in the full review are really just nitpicks.

[h1][b][u]Gameplay[/u][/b][/h1]

If you aern't aware, in this game you take control as the two main characters of the movie, WALL-E and EVE. Most of the time you're playing as WALL-E, but there are certain sections that you can play as her aswell. The pacing is pretty dang good, having the action segments and collecting item segments keep you engaged. And truth-be-told, the experience is pretty absorbing. Even though there is very little replay value, it does a good job of keeping you in the whole way through with the secondary objectives other than to go through the WALL-E Story, playing with friends. Overall I really feel the gameplay works, and doesn't feel too gimmicky or bland when playing through the story. One gripe I do have, is the way the secondary objectives work on action maps and sometimes the more confusing collecting item maps. If you miss one thing for those secondary objectives, you can't restart and you have to go back out to the chapter menu first then pick the mission you missed all the crates for. This can take a lot longer, since you actually have to play the level and re-collect everything. Itteration time is not a friend here.

[h1][b][u]GREPHICS[/u][/b][/h1]

I actually can say I owned this game before it came out on steam, and came out for the PS2/Original XBOX. There is another game for the PS3/XBOX360, and they are completely different. If it ever comes on steam, I might do a review. Since I never really played PS2 for games excluding this one, I can't say for certain if the quality of the graphics are good enough. Although, I do feel the game is capped at 30FPS and the graphical settings are turned down (Minus the fact they are set to 'high') since the PS3 and XBOX360 were out by this time. Even though this is the case, I gotta say, either because a GTX 1060 wasn't even a glimmer in NVIDIA'S eye by the time this was first release, I do like how there are no loading times AT ALL. Either that, or the manditory unskippable cutscenes do a good job of fooling you into not paying attention to load times. Which was a smart move, I gotta say.

[h1][b][u]Robot Cruelty PSA[/u][/b][/h1]

One thing that makes me hate this game with a passion [spoiler] Just kidding, I love it [/spoiler] is the fact that every time you die, you always get these super cruel cutscenes showing WALL-E falling into oblivion, looking up at you in the light like a ASPCA PSA, and it really hits me in the feels, man. Zenyatta would not be happy about this.

[h1][b][u]Overall[/u][/b][/h1]
If you're a fan of the curious little robot trash compactor, I whole-heartedly recommend this game. It may have some small flaws, but it shows how shovelware is beginning to slow down and that good movie games do exist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190859427', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1668035681}
review: This game is so amazing, It reminded me of my childhood when I watched the movie and bought the game. Now here I am years later playing WALL-E again, gaining the same experience I did when I was a kid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211092844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1546021696}
review:
Helpful advice: before you start playing, go to "(your Steam Folder)\steamapps\common\WALL E\WALL-E\GameSetup.exe" and configure the Video settings, making the video resolution to max, and configuring the controls in a way that you would find comfortable.

NOTE: you MUST set the In-Game Jump key and the Menu-Confirm key to the same button, or else you'll get stuck.

Review:

This game is a really fun 3D Platformer.
It brings a very interesting twist on platforming, as Wall-e, being a robot, can not jump very high.
However, if Wall-e uses a ramp and gains some speed, he can really leap very far.
This adds a lot of dynamic to the game.
The game also has a great variety of stages. There's platforming stages, exploration/collectaphon stages, speeding stages, flying stages, and shooting stages.
And while it starts pretty easy, it does get more difficult later on, as platforming will get more difficult, and enemies will try to prevent you from making progress.
Most of the stages also have collectables for you to find, which consist on BNL crates you can break, and Artificats you can collect. This adds a lot of replay value if you're into those kind of things.
My only complaint is that the later levels get pretty long, and the checkpoints are few and far between. Which means, if you have to quit, you might not have enought time to reach the next checkpoint, and therefor have to leave, erasing some progress.
The "video cutscenes" also don't look very well on modern computers, and the fact that you can't scip them can get annoying. However, the cutscenes made on the game's engine are very well made, and althought they don't give you the feelings you would get from watching the movie, the story is still very well presented. Both the Earth and the Axiom look great, giving you 2 very different enviorment styles - the junk that has piles up on earth, and the cleanness modern coridors of a space ship.
Overall, this game is a very enjopyable experience.
Just remember that this is a 2008 game, and a port of a PS2/PSP game, so expect to see PS2 graphics.
But they still look great.

review:
Ein sehr zu empfehlendes Spiel zu einem sehr zu empfehlenden Film.

review: Solve little puzzles and watch sequences from the movie + play some unlockable mini-games. Game mechanics is well done.  It´s not too hard but not boringly easy. The soundtrack is nice. No voice acting. Only negative point - the rendered movie sequences are quite low in quality. Get it if you want to relax.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168981779', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1487915244}
review: I played this game a while ago when I was about ten, and I loved it then! Seeing it on steam eight years later, I was thrilled to buy it and try it again. Although this isn't one of the best games out there by any means, I enjoy playing it as much as any other game, mainly for nostalgia, and also because it's just an overall great game! The puzzles, while not difficult, are fun and exiting, and the gameplay couldn't be much better! This is one of my favorite later-childhood games, and even as an adult, it's still very enjoyable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198181599267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1704293724}

author: {'steamid': '76561198083732711', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 1668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1711218850}
review: Супер я игру хоть купил за 419 рублей, но это ничего хорошо что с этой игрой можно вспомнить детство своё. Я даже вспомнил как любил эту игру. Я помню как я к бабушке каждые выходные ездил и там я играл у неё в WALLE вот здорово было. Теперь когда я играл и увидев игру я купил её чтобы вспомнить все уровни и что я собирал ящики. Рекомендую она вам может пригадится для воспоминаний детских +100000

author: {'steamid': '76561198079211773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1429217227}
review: I had this game before and it was great. The game brought all the fun it did before. I was really happy when they released it on steam on February 24, 2015. You play as a robot who travels across the universe to help humanity save the earth and to solve puzzles that an unthinking robot couldn't solve while all at the same time he is craving love. WHAT COULD BE BETTER THAN THAT??? This game holds the title Wall- E(rated E for everyone) so well. When they made this game it was definitely for the excellent gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049800268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1426457358}
review:
★★★☆☆
Man I loved this game, and I was thinking that WALL-E should be on Steam. And on Febuary 24 2015 they added 10 new games and I went to go and buy it as soon as I saw it but it wasn't in my Library until I checked today. This game is a game I will treasure for the rest of my life. I just wish Disney could add the Ratatouille game, another game that I remember was the Radiator Springs game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155510928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 14453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1423, 'last_played': 1700791227}
review:
So $18 because my son loves Wall-E.

First level is a tutorial, son enjoyed it because there is a short movie afterwards with 30+ Wall-E bots.
Second level is a 1:30 timed run down to the truck to take shelter from the incoming storm. 
Third level I expected a free form level I would just be able to let him play around in. Instead there is an extremely small level around the truck and the only thing to do is break 30 boxes. Son would have been happy to have control of the tv in the truck (press E and play a small clip or something) and be able to open and close the truck's cargo door. Alas.

Graphics are worse than PlayStation 2 Shrek the Third from ~2007 and the camera controls are a little too hard for little kids. after playing 225 hours
